title: OgNasty
author: OgNasty
created_time: May 10, 2022, 09:27:11 PMLast edit: January 11, 2024, 09:24:08 PM by OgNasty
content: The Biggest Loser Raffle...The first "Biggest Loser Raffle" (& second) seemed to be enjoyed by all so I thought it might be a good time to do another one.There is no fee to enter, but if you are selected as the biggest loser you are required to pay for the prize.  Due to shipping variances, this raffle will be restricted to continental US shipping addresses only.  If you would like to enter, please have a trading history with positive feedback and be ready to spend BTC and get nothing if you lose.  If you're unsure about participating, drop me a PM and say hi.  2 blocks will be selected to determine the outcome.  The first block selecting the loser and the second block selecting the winner. The winner cannot also be the loser.  The winner will supply a US address and receive their prize once the loser has paid for it.  Payment will be made to: 168WXhArv7Fasqvi2xm5MQMfLhG18jifMeThe cost to enter is a promise to pay $42 in BTC upon completion of the raffle.  You may select as many spots as you'd like.  Please select an open character or characters below to particpate.Participants:0- sweeteye1- FFrankie2- Bullion-n-BTC3- Suzuki Matt4- Cryptogreatdane5- Cryptogreatdane6- PreciousMetapsICT7- Cryptogreatdane8- FFrankie9- Bullion-n-BTCa- PreciousMetapsICTb- bill gatorc- 2stoutd- Cryptogreatdanee- Cryptogreatdanef- Bullion-n-BTC

comments.author: Cryptogreatdane
comments.body: Ill take d, 7, and e please

comments.author: Cryptogreatdane
comments.body: Quote from: Suzuki Matt on May 10, 2022, 10:09:27 PM3 please.    Same cost if you take 1 or 3 spots matt.. take 2 more while you can

comments.author: sweeteye
comments.body: A true loser only takes "0"That's me I'll never win

comments.author: bill gator
comments.body: I'll take slot "b" for bill - thank you for hosting a raffle that adds a little flare to our typical template. Trying to balance my desire to take more slots with the risk of paying for someone else's prize is a tough one.

comments.author: OgNasty
comments.body: Quote from: OgNasty on May 10, 2022, 09:27:11 PMParticipants:0- sweeteye1- FFrankie2- Bullion-n-BTC3- Suzuki Matt4- 5- 6- 7- Cryptogreatdane8- FFrankie9- Bullion-n-BTCa- b- bill gatorc- 2stoutd- Cryptogreatdanee- Cryptogreatdanef- Bullion-n-BTC4 more spots to go!  I'll let it go another 24 hours and if no takers and everyone is good with it, I'll fill the last spots myself (so long as the people who are currently entered have no problem with that).  Let's get this party started!  Somebody needs to win a free ounce of silver! I may need to rethink the name of these raffles in the future though.  It feels so much better to give to others than to receive yourself.  There really are no losers here except for those who don't participate.

comments.author: bill gator
comments.body: I can only speak for myself, but I would have no problem with you paying for me to get a new shiny coin in my collection. If you’re thinking of rebranding, you could go a million different avenues so it’s hard to suggest which way to go; maybe call it a “Mostly Free” Raffle or “15-Winner Raffle” because getting your raffle ticket paid for is definitely a win.

comments.author: OgNasty
comments.created_time: May 12, 2022, 08:08:58 AMLast edit: May 12, 2022, 07:51:27 PM by OgNasty
comments.body: Quote from: bill gator on May 12, 2022, 03:32:45 AMI can only speak for myself, but I would have no problem with you paying for me to get a new shiny coin in my collection. Ya, if I lose it's no problem.  It's if I win that would create a weird situation.  I'd basically be taking other people's money through some crypto wizardry, but it's really no different then anyone else winning as far as odds go, so I don't think there's a real issue.  I like to keep these moving, so if we don't fill the last two spots tomorrow I'll come up with some sort of magic to fill them.  Hopefully I wake up to the last 2 spots being taken.  With the price of our beloved cryptos plummeting to middle earth levels, it's nice to have a little fun around here.  EDIT: I can't post on this thread again until someone else does or this post hits 24 hours.  So maybe my "tomorrow" comment is more of a guideline than an actual rule.

comments.author: Cryptogreatdane
comments.body: Ill take 4 and 5 and role the dice. Either win or lose

comments.author: OgNasty
comments.body: Quote from: OgNasty on May 10, 2022, 09:27:11 PM2 blocks will be selected to determine the outcome.  The first block selecting the loser and the second block selecting the winner. The winner cannot also be the loser.A reminder (mostly for myself) how this game works.  We're now filled up with participants and ready to select 'Mr. Deep-pockets' who will so kindly donate some BTC for another forum member to take home a sweet sweet silvery prize.  We're currently working on block #736249, so to be funny let's use block #736269 to select the loser and block #736272 as the winner (to create some suspense).  You can view the current blocks here: https://www.blockchain.com/explorer (I'm sure there's a better place but this works)Good luck to everyone on this Friday the 13th (Ch ch ch, ah ah ah)...

comments.author: Cryptogreatdane
comments.body: And away we GOOOOOOoooooooo. Love raffles didnt even have to drive to the casino

comments.author: bill gator
comments.body: Quote from: OgNasty on May 13, 2022, 07:07:44 PMWe're currently working on block #736249, so to be funny let's use block #736269 to select the loser and block #736272 as the winner (to create some suspense).  Quoting for reference, in case anybody suspects OG is running a rigged raffle. Good luck to all of our participants, and a pre-emptive thank you to whoever is paying for my new shiny collectible!Current block: 736253

comments.author: OgNasty
comments.created_time: May 13, 2022, 08:21:24 PMLast edit: May 14, 2022, 07:41:15 PM by OgNasty
comments.body: Quote from: bill gator on May 13, 2022, 08:16:59 PMQuoting for reference, in case anybody suspects OG is running a rigged raffle. Shhhh...  They don't know how I do it yet.   *slowly shuts off hash determining software.Nothing to see here folks.  How about that weather?  Crazy right?"Biggest Loser" block hash ends in: Block 736269 = 6 = PreciousMetapsICThttps://www.blockchain.com/btc/block/00000000000000000000f3e84acdbaaa33692aa77a30e3bc3884645584594eb6Winning block hash ends in: Block 736272 = a = PreciousMetapsICThttps://www.blockchain.com/btc/block/00000000000000000000abd0ea2101f6aef40315d1d029fc66899224dbab319aQuote from: OgNasty on May 10, 2022, 09:27:11 PMThe winner cannot also be the loser.My apologies for not being on top of this yesterday.  We need to choose a new "Winner" block.I propose block #736420.Unless there is some sort of objection (or PreciousMetapsICT is chosen again), that will be our winner of the Binary Round.PreciousMetapsICT Please send 0.00143271 BTC to 168WXhArv7Fasqvi2xm5MQMfLhG18jifMe(42 / 29315) current exchange rate.Thank you!
